lines.content: * This is the main entrance of Duke programme.
* @param filePath the file path where duke data is stored.
* Runs the Duke programme by receiving user commands and executing the commands.
* Initializes new Duke user and runs the programme.
//todo: allow user to specify data path
* This is an command interface used in interacting with users' command.
* @param ui the user interface to output message.
* @throws DukeException general exception happens when using Duke.
void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* This handles command that deal with deadline task. Implements Command interface.
* Calls another constructor with (null) as argument.
* Calls another constructor with additional argument date=null.
* @param description the description of the task.
* @param description the description of the task.
* @param date the deadline date of the task.
* Returns true if no error in the arguments of deadline command, otherwise throws DukeException.
* @throws DukeException printout warning when description or date of the deadline command is empty.
* Always returns false since this is not an exit command.
// interface can clearer, but parent class can reduce repeating code, which is better?
* Adds a deadline task to task list and stores it.
* If the adding deadline command is not valid, an DukeException will be thrown.
* UI is included to notify the user.
* @param ui the user interface to output message.
* @throws DukeException exception happens during storage, or if the command is not valid.

* @throws DukeException exception happens when task number is empty or invalid.

* This handles command that deal with event task. Implements Command interface.

* This handles command that deal with todo task. Implements Command interface.
* Calls another constructor with (null) as argument.

* @throws DukeException printout warning when description or date of the todo command is empty.
* Always returns false since this is not an exit command.

* This class is used as interface with the user. It could reads from user and print message to the user.
* Returns the next line of user input being read.
* Prints the welcome screen of Duke.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints a dotted line with new line.
* Prints the exit message of Duke.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the information of the task added.
* @param list the list of tasks stored in Duke.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints each task in the task list.
* @param list the list of tasks stored in Duke.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list: ");

* @param list the list of task stored in Duke.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Prints the message of task being marked as done.
* @param finished the task being marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");

* Prints the list of available command and their usage.
String help = "Currently we support the following commands:\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'Todo <description>'") + "add a Todo task with description\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'Deadline <description> /by <dd/mm/yy>'") + "add a Deadline task with description and time\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'Event <description> /by <dd/mm/yy>'") + "add a Event task with description and time\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'Done <number>'") + "mark the nth task in the list as finished\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'Delete <number>'") + "delete the nth task in the list\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'Find <keywords>'") + "show the list of tasks with specified keywords\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'bye' OR 'exit' OR 'quit'") + "to exit the programme\n"
+ String.format("%1$-50s", "  'help'") + "to show a list of available command\n";
* Parser class to parse object. Methods are used in class level.
* Enumerator for the different parts of a command.
* Returns a command with relevant arguments.
* This method recognize the command intended to call, and parse the full command into different parts. Then
* pass relevant arguments to the command.
* @param fullCommand string of the full command
* @throws DukeException exception happens when unable to pass string to date.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
* Returns a hashtable of relevant parts to the string description of the parts.
* The first word is parsed as COMMAND. The following words before /at or /by is parsed as DESCRIPTION.
* The remaining is parsed as DATE.
* @param fullCommand string of the full command.
* @return a hashtable of Parts enumerator to string description of the part.
private static Hashtable<Parts, String> parseToDict(String fullCommand) {
* Returns a Date object by parsing the date String.
* Time zone is set as Singapore time by default.
* @param dateString the String describing the date.
* @throws DukeException exception occurs when unable to parse.
public static Date parseStringToDate(String dateString) throws DukeException {
* Returns the string of date by parsing a date.
* @param date the date to be parsed.
